text:
Hi, I'd like to generate a gallery in a custom theme. I store images in the Files directory.

Is a way to list files stored in the Files directory using HubL?
is there any documentation to use GraphQL to filter custom objects in HubSpot template or modules?
have you seen the Graph QL Theme?
what kind of hack do you mean?
Will there be a set number of images? OR will it constantly be changing?
I’d just create a gallery module
it depends on the marketing team ;)
I have a hack, but I've thought there is a smarter solution
Yeah just create a gallery module. Look at HubSpot’s gallery module for inspiration if y’all don’t want to use the native gallery module
If you want to generate galleries with some sort of external image api, then that’s a whole other can of worms
I'm curious whether the lack of this functionality is "a feature" or an oversight in implementation.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/use-graphql-data-in-your-website-pages> exposes how to use GraphQL to expose data in templates and modules specifically, let me know if you want to join the BETA!
You can use repeater fields or even this <https://devbeej.com/library/rich-text-image-parser/|hubdb technique>.

We also just recently had a HubSpot Essentials webinar where I showed how to do this.  The recording will be going up on the <https://www.youtube.com/c/HubSpotDevelopers/?sub_confirmation=1|HubSpot Developers YouTube channel> within the next week or two.

I figured out how to search for contacts using nodejs api client.
`const ApiResponse = await HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi.getById("7147901", ["phone"]);`
`phone = ApiResponse.body.properties.phone;`
But how do I search for files? Could somebody provide an example code snippet?
